      • verifyQuery

        public boolean verifyQuery(Query q,
                           java.net.Socket s)
        This method checks to make sure that the message is either meant for the user or for host.
        Parameters:
        q - the query.
        s - the socket that the connection is held on.
        Returns:
        a boolean value of true if the message is meant for the host, false otherwise

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String host,
                    int port,
                    java.lang.Thread callback,
                    java.lang.Thread failed)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method connects to the desired host and port.
        Parameters:
        host - The ip address.
        port - The port number.
        callback - A thread to run upon completion of the connection.
        failed - A thread to run if the connection failed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If IOException occurs.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String hostname,
                    java.lang.Thread callback,
                    java.lang.Thread failed)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        purpose: Established the connection between the two networked computers.
        Parameters:
        hostname - - the IP address or hostname of the computer hosting the program
        callback - - the thread between the two users so messages can be sent between the two
        failed - - tells the program if the message failed to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - throws an exception if the port number is incorrect or closes before the connection is established.
        java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        hostname - - the IP address or hostname of the computer that hosted the game
        message - - the message that is being sent to the other player

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String hostTo,
                        int port,
                        java.lang.String message)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        purpose: Sends the message to the outputstream to be received by the other player.
        Parameters:
        hostTo - - the IP address or hostname of the other computer that is connected
        port - - the port the two computer are communicating on
        message - - the message that is being sent to the other player
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - throws an exception if the port number is incorrect or closes before the connection is established.
        java.lang.Exception

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        purpose: Allows the users to login and maintain a continuous chat.
        Parameters:
        username - - the user's login ID
        password - - the user's password used to verify the user
        Returns:
        true if the user logged in successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - throws an exception if the port number is incorrect or closes before the connection is established.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - - throws an exception if the user's username and/or password is incorrect.
